Description: Rim and body sherd of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; interior: on rim, dilute lines between black bands; wall glazed black; top of lip glazed; exterior: lip and handle zone reserved with band between; glazed below; inscription in handle zone.
Type series: Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type B3
Curator's comments: Although Schlotzhauer (Schlotzhauer 2012) does not discuss this sherd, the profile finds parallels with his Type 9C South Ionian cup with everted rim. Type 9C cups correspond to Attic Siana or Gordion cups and find parallels with Hayes' Ionian Cup Type X (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116) and Vallet and Villard's Ionian Cup type B3 (Vallet and Villard, 1964, 87-88). The Type 9 shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape. Type 5 cups are rare at Naukratis whereas there are numerous examples of Type 9 cups. Both types were common drinking vessels found in Greeks sanctuaries, including the sanctuary of Aphrodite at Miletus.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIV, no. 465)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 673, no. 317)
Johnston 2006a / Trademarks on Greek Vases: Addenda (East Greek 207)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 52, no. 283)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.726) (Phase 3)
